description: Verified catastrophe records with confirmed commit hashes

catastrophes.name: Heartbleed
catastrophes.description: Missing bounds check in TLS heartbeat extension allowed reading 64k of server memory. Affected 66% of HTTPS servers.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Verified via surgical fetch on 2026-01-14. 3 ancestors found.

catastrophes.name: PwnKit
catastrophes.description: Local privilege escalation via pkexec. Vulnerability existed for 12+ years - classic systemic/architectural flaw where code assumed argc >= 1.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Verified via surgical fetch on 2026-01-14. Confirmed via osv.dev.

catastrophes.name: Log4Shell
catastrophes.description: JNDI injection via log messages. Affected virtually every Java application. Attacker could execute arbitrary code by getting app to log a malicious string.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Verified via surgical fetch on 2026-01-14. 3 ancestors found.

catastrophes.name: Dirty COW
catastrophes.description: Race condition in get_user_pages allowing local privilege escalation. Existed in Linux kernel since 2007.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Verified via surgical fetch on 2026-01-14. 3 ancestors found.

catastrophes.name: XZ Utils Backdoor
catastrophes.description: Sophisticated supply chain attack. Malicious code injected via build process to backdoor SSH authentication on Debian/Fedora.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Verified via surgical fetch on 2026-01-14. Both breaking and fixing commits confirmed.

catastrophes.name: Baron Samedit
catastrophes.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in sudo's sudoedit mode. Vulnerability existed since July 2011.
catastrophes.verification_notes: SHAs from Qualys writeup and Core-Research-Team. Breaking commit is abbreviated - expand with git rev-parse.

catastrophes.name: curl SOCKS5 Heap Overflow
catastrophes.description: Heap buffer overflow in SOCKS5 proxy handshake. Hostname could overflow into heap buffer.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Abbreviated SHAs from curl.se advisory. Expand with git rev-parse.

catastrophes.name: nginx DNS Resolver
catastrophes.description: Off-by-one write in ngx_resolver_copy() when processing DNS responses.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Fix SHA from x41-dsec.de advisory and GitHub commit.

catastrophes.name: Git Credential Leak
catastrophes.description: Credential leak via malicious URLs with embedded newlines.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Fix SHA confirmed from GitHub git/git commit.

catastrophes.name: Apache Struts (Equifax)
catastrophes.description: RCE via Content-Type header in Jakarta Multipart parser. Led to Equifax breach affecting 147M people.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Fix SHA from ChatGPT research - needs verification.

catastrophes.name: Shellshock
catastrophes.description: Arbitrary code execution via malformed function definitions in bash. Existed since bash 1.03 (1989). Affected CGI, SSH, DHCP clients.
catastrophes.verification_notes: Need to find fix commit via git log --grep=CVE-2014-6271 in bash repo.

pending_verification.name: Dirty Pipe
pending_verification.notes: SHA appears to be truncated or incorrect - not found in linux repo.

pending_verification.name: Spectre Variant 1
pending_verification.notes: Multiple commits across kernel - architectural, not single fix

pending_verification.name: Meltdown
pending_verification.notes: KPTI implementation - multiple commits. Architectural mitigation, not single fix.
